propel.core.initialisation
Interface InitGuard

All Known Implementing Classes:
MultiInitGuard, SingleInitGuard
public interface InitGuard

Interface of class that implement an initialisation guard. Such classes can be used to enforce checks that a class has been initialised one or more times, by throwing exceptions when such conditions are not met.

          Call to assert that initialisation has taken place prior to this call

Method Detail

initialise

void initialise()
Call to initialise. Depending no the implementation this may be a call-once method.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The class has already been initialised and multiple initialisations are not allowed

assertInitialised

void assertInitialised()
Call to assert that initialisation has taken place prior to this call

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The class has not been initialised

uninitialise

void uninitialise()
Call to un-initialise this object e.g. when cleaning up.
